name: Satay Chicken with Restaurant Style Peanut Sauce (Indonesian/Bali style)
description: Though Satay Chicken is better known as Thai or Malaysian food, it actually originated from Indonesia and the Indonesian version is by far the simplest. The Peanut Sauce is my own - refer to the notes for why I prefer this to the authentic version. It is thick so it is great for dolloping, rather than a thin dipping sauce. Satay Chicken is fabulous for outdoor BBQ's, parties and for fast midweek meals! They also reheat really well in the microwave. They can be cooked on the outdoor grill, on the stove or under the grill/broiler.
recipeIngredient: 1 lb / 500g   chicken thigh fillets ((skinless and boneless))
2 1/2 tbsp kecap manis ((thick sweet soy sauce - see Note 1))
12 - 14  small bamboo skewers (, soaked in water for at least 30 minutes)
1 small or 1/2 large   onion (, diced (red, brown, yellow or white))
3  birds eye chillis (, sliced (or sub with hot sauce))
1 cup coconut milk ((full fat is better, but light is ok))
1/4 cup crushed unsalted roasted peanuts ((buy crushed or chop your own))

itemListElement.text: Cut the chicken into 1.5cm/0.5" cubes. Thread onto skewers - 4 to 5 pieces per skewer.
itemListElement.name: Cut the chicken into 1.5cm/0.5" cubes. Thread onto skewers - 4 to 5 pieces per skewer.

itemListElement.text: Combine kecap manis and butter, then brush onto chicken.
itemListElement.name: Combine kecap manis and butter, then brush onto chicken.

itemListElement.text: Cook the skewers on a hot BBQ (outdoor grill) or on the stove in a large non stick fry pan (add a splash of oil, and make sure the skewers will fit in the pan). Grill/broiler would also work.
itemListElement.name: Cook the skewers on a hot BBQ (outdoor grill) or on the stove in a large non stick fry pan (add a splash of oil, and make sure the skewers will fit in the pan). Grill/broiler would also work.

itemListElement.text: Serve, garnished with crushed peanuts, shallots and with lime wedges and Peanut Sauce on the side.
itemListElement.name: Serve, garnished with crushed peanuts, shallots and with lime wedges and Peanut Sauce on the side.

itemListElement.text: Heat oil in a small saucepan over medium high heat. Add garlic, onion and chillis and cook for 3 minutes until onion is translucent.
itemListElement.name: Heat oil in a small saucepan over medium high heat. Add garlic, onion and chillis and cook for 3 minutes until onion is translucent.

itemListElement.text: Turn heat down to medium, then add peanut butter, coconut milk, kecap manis, soy sauce and salt. Simmer for 10 minutes, whisking occasionally.
itemListElement.name: Turn heat down to medium, then add peanut butter, coconut milk, kecap manis, soy sauce and salt. Simmer for 10 minutes, whisking occasionally.

itemListElement.text: Use a handheld stick to puree (so the onion and chilli blends throughout the sauce - this is key). (See Note 2 for blending instructions) Stir through crushed peanuts and lime juice and simmer for 2 minutes. Allow to cool slightly before serving or to room temperature - it will thicken.
itemListElement.name: Use a handheld stick to puree (so the onion and chilli blends throughout the sauce - this is key). (See Note 2 for blending instructions) Stir through crushed peanuts and lime juice and simmer for 2 minutes. Allow to cool slightly before serving or to room temperature - it will thicken.

review.reviewBody: Oh my, this was a really sensational and easy dish. Easiest marinade ever. Can't wait to make it again, next time on the barbie.

I made this last night, and it's a winner - easy, tasty, delicious. Even my son, who doesn't like peanuts said "yum!". The sauce was easy to throw together, and the whole dish is a good option for a quick, tasty meal with little prep required. I grilled my chicken in the oven, at the same time as the sauce cooked, so the whole dish took the same amount of time as it took the rice to cook.
Forgot to add stars to my comment!

A very tasty peanut sauce. I made the mistake of using a plastic  packet of concentrated coconut cream, so my sauce was too thick but I just thinned it out with more kecap manis , lime juice and soy sauce. Very popular recipe in my household.

Fantastic recipe.  Thank you.

Easy to make and super tasty, even without the satay sauce.
I haven't been to Bali for 26 years. Thank you for the satay and nasi goreng recipes.  They take me back on memory lane. Bless you.

Hi Nagi,

Made this last night and it was such a hit with my guests. The chicken was so simple but so delicious and we were eating the sauce with spoons because it was that good haha. 

Love your recipes!

Hi Nagi
I’ve made this recipe for a few of my family and friends I have found that adding a touch of honey in the satay just adds to the flavour. I usually serve it with the Nasi Goreng makes a really special meal
Thank you so much your recipes they are special and make an amateur cook like me cook lots of delicious food 
Thanks so much
James
This lady's recipes are amazing. Try her shrimp pad thai too! It's out of sight.

Hi Nagi, 
I have tried the Indonesian and the Thai satays both yum!
Do you have a recipe for Lombok satay? (Island near Bali) They reckon theirs is the best 🤣 apparently it has no peanuts!?!

Regards

Kim
